text: Setiptiline (brand name Tecipul), also known as teciptiline, is a tetracyclic antidepressant (TeCA) which acts as a noradrenergic and specific serotonergic antidepressant (NaSSA). It was launched in 1989 for the treatment of depression in Japan by Mochida. ==Pharmacology== ===Pharmacodynamics=== {| class="wikitable floatleft" style="font-size:small;" |+ Setiptiline |- ! Site !! Ki (nM) !! Species !! Ref |- | || >10,000 (IC50) || Rat || |- | ' || 220 (IC50)' || Rat || |- | || >10,000 (IC50) || Rat || |- | 5-HT1A || || || |- | 5-HT2A || || || |- | 5-HT2C || || || |- | α1 || || || |- | α2 || 24.3 (IC50) || Rat || |- | H1 || || || |- | || || || |- class="sortbottom" | colspan="4" style="width: 1px;" | Values are Ki (nM), unless otherwise noted. The smaller the value, the more strongly the drug binds to the site. |} Setiptiline acts as a norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor, α2-adrenergic receptor antagonist, and serotonin receptor antagonist, likely at the 5-HT2 subtypes, as well as an H1 receptor inverse agonist/antihistamine. ==Chemistry== Setiptiline has a tetracyclic structure and is a close analogue of mianserin and mirtazapine, with setiptiline being delta(13b,4a),4a-carba-mianserin, and mirtazapine being 6-azamianserin. ==See also== * Aptazapine * Mianserin * Mirtazapine ==References== Category:Alpha-2 blockers Category:H1 receptor antagonists Category:Noradrenergic and specific serotonergic antidepressants Category:Piperidines Category:Serotonin antagonists Category:Tetracyclic antidepressants
title: Setiptiline
